data.name: BuildEngineCallbacksInTaskHostUnsupported
data.value: MSB5022: The MSBuild task host does not support running tasks that perform IBuildEngine callbacks. If you wish to perform these operations, please run your task in the core MSBuild process instead. A task will automatically execute in the task host if the UsingTask has been attributed with a "Runtime" or "Architecture" value, or the task invocation has been attributed with an "MSBuildRuntime" or "MSBuildArchitecture" value, that does not match the current runtime or architecture of MSBuild.
data.comment: {StrBegin="MSB5022: "} "Runtime", "Architecture", "MSBuildRuntime", and "MSBuildArchitecture" are all attributes in the project file, and thus should not be localized.

data.name: ConflictingTaskAssembly
data.value: MSB4008: A conflicting assembly for the task assembly "{0}" has been found at "{1}".
data.comment: {StrBegin="MSB4008: "}UE: This message is shown when the type/class of a task cannot be resolved uniquely from a single assembly.

data.name: ExpectedEventToBeSerializable
data.value: Event type "{0}" was expected to be serializable using the .NET serializer. The event was not serializable and has been ignored.

data.name: ModifyingTaskHostEnvironmentHeader
data.value: Making the following modifications to the environment received from the parent node before applying it to the task host:
data.comment: Only ever used when MSBuild is run under a "secret" environment variable switch, MSBuildTaskHostUpdateEnvironmentAndLog=1

data.name: ModifyingTaskHostEnvironmentVariable
data.value: Setting '{0}' to '{1}' rather than the parent environment's value, '{2}'.
data.comment: Only ever used when MSBuild is run under a "secret" environment variable switch, MSBuildTaskHostUpdateEnvironmentAndLog=1

data.name: Shared.CannotChangeItemSpecModifiers
data.value: "{0}" is a reserved item metadata, and cannot be modified or deleted.
data.comment: UE: Tasks and OM users are not allowed to remove or change the value of the built-in metadata on items e.g. the meta-data "FullPath", "RelativeDir", etc. are reserved.

data.name: Shared.InvalidFilespecForTransform
data.value: The item metadata "%({0})" cannot be applied to the path "{1}". {2}
data.comment: UE: This message is shown when the user tries to perform path manipulations using one of the built-in item metadata e.g. %(RootDir), on an item-spec that's not a valid path. LOCALIZATION: "{2}" is a localized message from a CLR/FX exception.

data.name: TaskNotMarshalByRef
data.value: MSB4077: The "{0}" task has been marked with the attribute LoadInSeparateAppDomain, but does not derive from MarshalByRefObject. Check that the task derives from MarshalByRefObject or AppDomainIsolatedTask.

data.name: Shared.PathTooLong
data.value: Path: {0} exceeds the OS max path limit. The fully qualified file name must be less than {1} characters.
